posts.author: KailPendragon

The idea is to have a spontaneous spellblade by combining Sorc with Bard for extra spells and spell slots plus bard/curse song buffing/debuffing, not to mention classed tumble, mid AB progression, UMD and Taunt. Autostill benefits both casting parties involved. Trap skills for extra versatility, Taunt to be an annoying arse. Druid 1 is in for +2 AB in natural areas and enhanced summons, animal empathy (often times a life saver early on) and an animal companion useful at the lowest levels.

Unfinalized and unoptimized layout here, to give a general idea of the build and for you to get into butchering frenzy. I notice now I forgot heavy armor. Doh! What to drop?

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Just off the top of my head, understand, as it is a combo I haven't considered before, but other than a desire to gain empathy, wouldn't taking sorc levels earlier get the familiar and arcane summons into the act fast enough? I've found that the dire wolf & then spider handled duties pretty well until the skels were available and then it gets easier since they can't be critted. The only issue was healing them and IIRC I used negative energy during combat, but the skels seemed superior to all the animal forms in combat especially buffed since they actually hold a weapon that can be enchanted (like the pixie!).

As for the empathy issue, I'm considering ranger rather than druid if just getting stuck in there for that skill. You won't be able to get the companion, of course, but only one "pal" can be active at once anyway and I find better utility in the arcane variety. Also, your will saves should be just fine per bard & sorc offsetting the low Wis base and since ranger has a fort primary like the druid, it should balance things in a similar fashion. I realize it is only a single level but you would gain an AB and martial weaponry and still be able to access empathy if so desired. Since DW is not a consideration, your character can wear whatever armor is preferred.

Just a first impression, mind you, hoping to spark some more thoughts on the subject.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
The leveling order preepic presented in the layout is still not optimized. I just splashed in Bard 11/Druid 1/Sorc 8 as they came (I only cared about taking druid early for the extra AB in natural areas, early animal empathy, enhanced summons and weapon proficiency). In epic leveling is determined by getting to select autostill I-III and the two epic spells. So, aye, Sorc can be acquired first (and I find the Imp familiar to be extremely efficient)... it should also help the leveling with an advantageous ECL.

I have to admit that druid is chosen with WoG in mind: there druid 1 (or cleric 1 with animal domain) lets you get the summons of a higher lvl including at lvl 9 getting lvl 10 summons which are big mofos elemental princes (and anyhow you get to choose from a variety of summons at each level, settable through a book of summons, including elemental of increasing strength which are of course crit immunes). Enhanced summons are a considerable advantage on WoG. Ranger grants +1 BAB, but loses -1 AB in natural areas. It doesn't let one get heavy armor for free and one cannot use the FE feat slot for GSF since no SF feat is taken at all. One gets classed set trap though. If I were to drop druid I'd get Ftr: free heavy armor and an extra combat proficiency (BF) and +1 BAB. I'd say that would be a viable choice where druid's enhanced summons are not so attractive as on WoG. Paladin would also be a natural option, "exchanging" one free combat feat (BF) for enhanced saves. Thanks for reminding me of a broader scenario.

It's great to hear someone else's perspective. Thanks Hip.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content: How about Cleric? Go Sorc 23 / Bard 16 / Cleric 1 and you have the option to grab Divine Might or Shield (since you have a healthy 20 CHA). I would drop Toughness for Power Attack and Empower Spell (yes, ouch) for the Divine Might/Shield. Pick Ehlonna as your deity to grab Animal so you get the same summoning bonus. Cleric also gets you heavy armor. Downside is you're stuck with Simple Weapons...unless you drop a feat (Toughness?) to grab Martial Weapons (and forget about Divine Might/Shield).

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Well, that's a nice variant Demos. Thanks!

One loses -2 AB in natural areas and animal empathy and the animal companion as low level helpers but gets access to a divine feat which is not bad considering that Cha is going to be maxed by gear/buffs anyhow. Also, access to heavy armor which is granted by cleric is a bigger help than AE and animal companion early on and never ceases to be good. Food for thought, eh!

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Is a base 14 Set Trap high enough to set deadly traps?

If not, and if you really like the advantage of setting deadly traps, I have been examining the paucity of skill points and am wondering if you could shift points from Perform (you only need 3 together with the spare one) over to Disable (to glean the synergy) since you will have the Emp Eagle's available prior to singing and maxed Cha from items as you described. Should be easy to reach Perform 30 at a lower base skill.

I haven't worked out the trap DCs myself, though, but I do remember that any cross-class that achieves base 21 and has decent Dex (or Dex buff) can set all traps except epic ones outside of combat. And then you have the additional boost of +4 from singing while setting a trap. But perhaps, the trap skills were just a convenient dumping ground for spare skillpoints? ?

Now that cleric dump suggestion per Demos (perhaps w/Trickery) may also hold more value if it means easy access to setting all deadly traps, but I believe you can still set deadlies with the druid tertiary as well.

A sorceress setting deadly holy traps. How unscrupulous!

Just a random thought negotiating the vastness of a featureless sky... now in print

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
15 Set Trap is enough to set all deadly traps but gas ones (on a take 20, outside of combat), which I generally do not use. That Dex score is surely gonna benefit from some gear/buff increase so the 15 mark is easily reached. There also the possibility to use Set Trap enhancing gear. This is not supposed to be a real trap expert but rather it's someone that can use traps for tactical advantages, so Disable Trap has been left to 1 so that one can autorecover his own traps that were not set off. Keep present that deadly traps can be disarmed only by rogues and that even if recovery is possible to non rogues it's a further 10 points higher, which this guy won't be able to reach, even with song, without dropping some other skill (even with song on one needs to spend a further 25-30 skillpoints on DisableTrap to reach the mark). Also, I do not wanna be dependant on song for trap setting/recovering since trap setting/recovery is a somewhat long process to be done outside of combat and it would mean using up a lot of song slots each time. Now if one knows for sure te can count on trap setting/disabling enhancing gear, then one can possibly rearrange skillpoints to be able to recover deadly traps (not set by oneself) too.

BTW, if you notice, I always try to get trap skills in my builds. They are a great tactical advantage and combat option. It's a peeve of mine, alike Craft Wand

posts.author: shia luck
posts.content:
Got to love the synergy between sorc and bard , and what sorc wouldn't like a lvl16 bard/curse song on demand?

Even with WoG's rules (they sound nice btw, druid needs more love, and I didn't even know it was possible to create lvl10 summons!), cleric with animal domain seems a better choice. Animal empathy of 4 (6 with buffs?) at early levels doesn't sound very reliable. Mind you the only time I visited WoG, some stirges were messing up my hair and I could have done with at least an attempt at dominating them. *grin*

As Demos said tho, finding two feats is not easy. (Why, oh why, does divine might need a str based feat as a prerequisite???????? I never understood that *sigh*. Still at least you have the str to get it!)

Biggest issues I see with this is dispellability, which I find a pain with a spellsword, but you want that lvl16 song. Taunt, bard and curse song and weapon buffs are so nice soooooo *shrug*... and lack of quickslots! I can just fit my sorc spells and a couple of feats into the quickbars. Adding in bard spells as well?

I notice you nearly always take scribe scroll. Are scroll DCs caster lvl based on WoG? Otherwise I would be tempted to drop scribe scroll and toughness for power attack and DM (if you went with cleric). If you are front line meleeing, DM seems to give more? I think I'd keep empower spell for mantle availablity and power.
